Bonjour C=C3=A9dric,
In fact, I want to have a black box test of my method.=

my method have this shape:

Result execute (String actionName, confdata da=
ta){
....
Action a =3D findAction(actionName);
Result result =3D a.process =
(someohterdata);
if (result.isLast())
    retrun result;
else
    return pr=
ocess(result.getNextAction(), result.getData();

}

the execute method call=
s a.process method of the action depending on
it's result the execute metho=
d will execute another action or will return
the final result.
for my tests=
 i would mock the action a and the result .
thx


On 3/26/06, C=C3=A9dric B=
eust =E2=99=94 <cbeust@...> wrote:
>
>  On 3/24/06, amine achergui <=
amine.achergui@...> wrote:
> >
> > Hi folks,
> > Is there any test pa=
ttern to test a recursive method ( in my case,
> > the method's body calls =
 collaborators thus in the test method i use
> > mocks).
> > Is there any p=
attern or recipe to solve this?
>
>
> I'll answer with a different question=
:  are you trying to "white box test"
> your function or do you just want t=
o make sure it works?
>
> If the latter, then you shouldn't really care how=
 your method is
> implemented
> (recursively, iteratively, with continuatio=
ns, etc...).  You know that
> given
> a certain input, you expect a certain=
 output and you should write your
> test
> with that in mind.
>
> Now, if y=
ou want to "white box test", that's a very different (and
> interesting) qu=
estion.  First of all, I would love to know why you
> absolutely need to kn=
ow that recursion is working, but that's just my
> personal curiosity.
>
> =
Without seeing your code, it's hard to give specific advice, but I suspect
=
>
> that in such case, you are going to need some collaboration from the
> =
method
> itself so that it can report about the recursion state to your tes=
t method
> (depth of the stack, iteration level, etc...).
>
> Hope this hel=
ped.
>
> --
> C=C3=A9dric
> http://testng.org
>
